channel.title: Job Board Manager
channel.description: Just another PickPlugins Demo Sites site

item.title: Senior Web and Digital Communications Officer
item.dc:creator: hasanrang05
item.content:encoded: This is an exciting opportunity for a WordPress front-end developer to join our dynamic communications team. With a remit to deliver innovative digital solutions, we strive to meet and exceed user expectations and to drive better council communications and services across digital channels. With a thorough grounding in WordPress, you will be responsible for implementing themes and any associated plugin development across our portfolio of websites. We are looking for someone who has: – Knowledge and experience in responsive WordPress theme development; – Technical capabilities in PHP, HTML5, CSS3 and jQuery; – Experience of MySQL and formats such as JSON or XML desirable; – Sound understanding of WordPress best practice and security; – Basic knowledge of Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator etc. You will also be able to work effectively in a multi-discipline team and be able to work independently, using your own initiative to problem-solve and delegate. You will need to communicate our work to managers, staff and service users, and support other officers to publish content online. This is a fast-moving work environment and you will need to handle multiple tasks at the same time and prioritise jobs as they come in. This is an exciting time to be part of the communications team and an opportunity to shape the future of digital services for Devon citizens. For an informal discussion please contact Tom Dixon on 01392 383000 / tom.dixon@devon.gov.uk or Carl Haggerty on 01392 383000 or carl.haggerty@devon.gov.uk.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: This is an exciting opportunity for a WordPress front-end developer to join our dynamic communications team. With a remit to deliver innovative digital solutions, we strive to meet and exceed user expectations and to drive better council communications and services across digital channels.

item.title: Imaging Creative Manager
item.dc:creator: hasanrang05
item.content:encoded:
Amazon Product Imaging builds the world’s best online shopping experience through photography, video, graphic design, and usability design enabling millions of customers to make more informed purchasing decisions. Imaging at Amazon is a large and fast-growing network of teams located throughout North America, Europe, and Asia, focusing on fashion and product photography, photo retouching, graphic design, video and CGI production, automated image acquisition, and image support services. We are continually innovating and setting new industry standards for showcasing 10s of millions of products across multiple global marketplaces. We are obsessed with innovating on behalf of our customers, and continually push beyond the boundaries of traditional e-commerce photography and videography. The Amazon Product Imaging team is seeking an accomplished Media Quality Manager to become one of the key leaders on our growing masthead. The ideal candidate will have an exceptional professional background delivering creative outputs of best-in-class product photography and video across retail, editorial, advertising, and e-commerce categories. In addition, the candidate should be highly motivated, self-directed, and able to thrive in a dynamic atmosphere. This role will require a superb eye for style, visual composition, and attention to detail, as well as an exceptional talent for using quantitative analysis to assess trends in the quality output of the studios and the needs of our business partners and customers. RESPONSIBILITIES - Drive long-term strategic initiatives to keep the studio’s creative output on trend, consistent, standard, and always appealing to our business partners and customer. - Build partnership with all creative stakeholders (Imaging, business partner) to define the above, calibrate the quality bar, and drive all aesthetic decisions. - Mentor, train and develop creative teams to improve quality. - Participate or lead Global Imaging Standard Committee for assigned product category, identify categories in need of improving, initiate testing for refresh proposal, and design/manage all related documentation across digital platforms. - Create/establish a regular communication system on style guide updates for all stakeholders of creative chain from senior leadership to operators. - Partner with Creative Production Manager to improve studio quality bar on behalf of the customer with decision based on data analysis and regular operation audits. - Partner with Creative Production Manager to define and hire studio creative resources with skillsets to raise quality bar. - Deliver regular feedback to creative studio stakeholders in order to drive quality improvement and skillset growth. - Participate with studio leadership in operational and budgetary planning and drive all creative decisions with the mindset of cost effectiveness - Establish ownership for image coverage for specific marketplaces/categories. Partner with business teams to increase image coverage in a cost effective manner, utilizing vendor images or automation whenever possible. To learn more about Product Imaging, visit our page at http://bit.ly/AmazonImaging

Qualifications

· Bachelor’s degree · Professional experience in Art Direction, Styling or Photography · Proficiency with Photoshop, in Design, Acrobat and MS Office/Exchange required ·Travel required up to 10% of the time

Preferred Qualifications

· Bachelor’s degree in Art preferred · Experience in high-end retail industry/ eCommerce · Working knowledge of still and moving Imaging software · Demonstrated experience measuring and auditing creative quality output as well as providing root cause analysis and action plan for improvement · Exceptional ability to lead and influence creative decisions while collaborating with a variety of stakeholders · Experience hiring, developing, and managing a team

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Amazon Product Imaging builds the world’s best online shopping experience through photography, video, graphic design, and usability design enabling millions of customers to make more informed purchasing decisions.

item.title: Studio Operations Manager
item.dc:creator: hasanrang05
item.content:encoded:
Amazon Product Imaging builds the world’s best online shopping experience through photography, video, graphic design, and usability design enabling millions of customers to make more informed purchasing decisions. Imaging at Amazon is a large and fast-growing network of teams located throughout North America, Europe, and Asia, focusing on fashion and product photography, photo retouching, graphic design, video and CGI production, automated image acquisition, and image support services. We are continually innovating and setting new industry standards for showcasing 10s of millions of products across multiple global marketplaces. We are obsessed with innovating on behalf of our customers, and continually push beyond the boundaries of traditional e-commerce photography and videography.

Amazon is looking for an experienced Studio Operations Manager to lead studio operations in a commercial photography studio environment. As a Studio Operations Manager, you will oversee the workflow of high volumes of products between fulfillment center(s) and studio(s), owning procurement, inventory, accounting compliance and loss prevention of product. You set daily production goals and ensure resources are in place to meet targets, coordinating directly with studio, retail, FC/facility and logistics teams to ensure seamless planning for product requiring imaging. You are responsible for short and long-term operational planning, including allocating labor, leading daily planning meetings, and assigning job duties. You will forecast future volumes and make plans to ensure capacity meets demand, creating contingency plans and reacting quickly to changing priorities. You are responsible for As a leader in the studio, you ensure standard operating procedures are followed, identify inefficiencies in workflow and drive a culture of continuous improvement. You collaborate and share best practices with your peers worldwide, delivering innovative operating procedures that can scale at high volumes while motivating a team of people to deliver results. RESPONSIBILITIES · Day to day management and direction of studio operations function · Planning and overseeing the flow of product and virtual assets through all stages of the studio workflow · Staffing/workforce planning for Studio Operations · Using systems/data to track and plan for volume and flow of product that requires imaging · Contributing kaizen expertise and driving a culture of continuous improvement within studio and/or region · Collecting and analyzing data and testing solutions for process improvements and new initiatives · Regularly reporting key productivity and quality metrics to stakeholders · Implementing studio-wide safety programs including disaster preparedness · Providing daily supervision as well as mentoring, training, development and performance management of Studio Operations team · Creating training and process documentation Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Affirmative Action Employer – F/M/V/D

Qualifications

· Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required · Professional experience in a high volume, high production operations environment · Proficiency with Microsoft office · Experience managing a team/function · Excellent English proficiency (written and oral) · Occasional travel may be required

Preferred Qualifications

· Previous experience working in a high volume commercial studio, or fulfillment center in an operational management capacity · Demonstrated ability to manage high volumes of workflow including prioritization, planning and task delegation under tight deadlines · Experience successfully leading teams/functions through change · Proficiency using multiple platforms and software to create/measure productivity and other operational metrics · Experience identifying and implementing process improvements, preferably with LEAN or Six Sigma methodology · Obsession with delighting customers · Project management skills · Excellent analytical & problem solving skills · Ability to influence and build successful working relationships with a diverse set of partners

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Amazon Product Imaging builds the world’s best online shopping experience through photography, video, graphic design, and usability design enabling millions of customers to make more informed purchasing decisions.

item.title: Senior Software Developer - Xbox
item.dc:creator: hasanrang05
item.content:encoded: The System Engineering team within Large Screen Devices (LSD) has an immediate opportunity for a Senior Software Developer. We are looking for a Software Developer with broad firmware and software experience, especially around operating system integration with various hardware platforms. This position is responsible for providing technical guidance regarding drivers, firmware, and operating system capabilities and interfaces across multiple hardware development teams as well as being able to work at higher levels in the application stack directly with the operating and application development teams. This is a high-visibility role for a senior software developer who is comfortable dealing with ambiguity, driving features from inception to production and is seeking to innovate at a quick pace. The ideal candidate has a proven track record in cross-group collaboration, driving for results and passion for understanding all layers of the software stack as well as design and coding skills and a passion for customers. You will participate in the architecture, design and implementation of software to create integrated end-to-end solutions. You will utilize your breadth of experience and range of expertise to work cross-organization with the operating system, application platforms, firmware, and hardware teams to drive platform software design and test definition, performance optimization and drive system issues to resolution. You will work with other highly skilled project team members including system, electrical, optical, audio, hardware, and software engineers. You will participate in the elaboration of the scenarios, help analyze the existing products and infrastructure, understand how to leverage this infrastructure and help design, architect and implement new pieces to fill in the gaps to create integrated end to end experiences. Qualifications: A BS/MS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science A minimum 7 years’ experience developing software that controls hardware (firmware, low-level software) A minimum 7 years’ experience with C++, C and some assembly. Experience with Visual Studio and the Win32 API. Experience with audio and video pipelines and APIs is a definite plus Experience in the design and implementation of hardware/software interfaces Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status.

item.title: Global Hotel and Corporate Apartment Manager
item.dc:creator: hasanrang05
item.content:encoded:
Google operates on a global scale, but each office seeks to emulate the same Googley feel of our Mountain View, California home base. As a Workplace Service Program Manager, you build consistent, outstanding workplace experiences around the world. You design, implement and manage Google's service offerings -- including fitness and massage. You're a great communicator who is comfortable taking on complex projects with a diverse set of stakeholders. You believe that great isn't good enough. You bring an analytical mind to constantly improve the efficiency and efficacy of your projects, from building new workplace tools and applications to mergers and acquisitions. You get satisfaction from knowing your clients are happy, healthy and productive, and are excited about joining a fast-paced, collaborative team that is reinventing what a workplace can be. The Global Hotel and Corporate Apartment Manager will be responsible for growing and overseeing this program around the world. You will be ensuring we set and meet the appropriate day to day service level standards while challenging industry norms to create a better user experience and model. You will work with a variety of internal and external partners to iterate and achieve these goals. Help make the travel experience great and keep Googlers at their best.
Responsibilities
  • Design, build and lead a unique hotel and corporate apartment programs and create amazing travel experiences for Googlers
  • Work with vendor and internal partners to achieve mission/goals of the program
  • Re-imagine user experience and technology integration to create better model
  • Analyze results around KPIs and work with vendors and partners to adjust and iterate
  • Ensure alignment with partners and manage change amongst array of stakeholders
Minimum qualifications
  • 4 years of experience in a leadership role in the hospitality industry.
Preferred qualifications
  • Build strong relationships and influence with and without authority through relevant and tailored communication. Ability to delegate.
  • Aptitude in financial management, financial reports and analysis.
  • Inspires teams to work towards common goals, share best practices, and continually evolve the program to reach objectives.
  • Strategically leverages broad expertise in subject matter and in-depth collected knowledge from all of partners to execute and evolve program while creating and implementing programs that impact/add value to the REWS organization as a whole.
  • Unifies and provides strategic direction and leadership to internal Google stakeholders as well as vendor partners. Able to thrive amidst ambiguity and reprioritize and adapt to the business's changing needs.
  • Proven track record in delivering on operational excellence and KPIs. Strong communicator with excellent listening and speaking skills.
Area
Just as Google products always focus on the user, Google offices focus on the Googler. From state-of-the-art green construction projects to maintaining our resident T. Rex skeleton (named Stan), the Real Estate and Workplace Services team builds environments that keep Googlers feeling inspired and energized. We're a team of inquisitive real estate, construction and facilities operations professionals that are constantly searching for new ways to improve workplace efficiency and make Google a great place to come to work everyday.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Google operates on a global scale, but each office seeks to emulate the same Googley feel of our Mountain View, California home base. As a Workplace Service Program Manager, you build consistent, outstanding workplace experiences around the world.

item.title: Google for Work, Contracts Manager
item.dc:creator: demo
item.content:encoded:
Google for Work helps companies around the globe be more productive, mobile and collaborative by "going Google." From educational institutions to government agencies, you support business of all sizes, helping them ramp-up quickly on enterprise offerings. You're a strong partner for these new customers, and you are a collaborative team member, working across the Google for Work team to make sure new clients get the best customer experience Google can provide. As a Google for Work Order Management Specialist, your flawless project management skills and admitted love of organization make sure their transition goes smoothly. Deal Desk is responsible for providing business process, legal and operations support to Sales in the closure of commercial contracts for Google for Work products and services. You will drive enhancements to both processes and policies which will increase our operational efficiency. You will influence strong working relationships with Google for Work Sales teams and other Google for Work functions. You must have exceptional communication, organizational and time management skills and be comfortable juggling multiple tasks while meeting strict deadlines. At the same time, you should have a bias for execution and a high level of drive and creativity to constantly improve your area of responsibility. You will develop scalable solutions for managing the contract process. You will become a Subject Matter Expert (SME) to train Deal Desk on provisions, risk analysis, objection handling, etc. and learn more about the end-to-end product and operations lifecycle.
Responsibilities
  • Assist in reviewing and responding to requests for information/proposal/quotation and answer questions regarding enterprise templates and fallback positions. Communicate directly with prospects and customers regarding clarification of Google’s rationale for contract terms.
  • Participate in all agreement negotiations with customers including conducting some negotiations without LTM (Legal) participation. Assist in reviewing and responding to customer contract redlines and draft language for internal stakeholder review.
  • Analyze issues, draft fallbacks, and consult with legal prior to implementation. Identify any compliance issues and escalate as needed.
  • Streamline and rationalize existing contractual structure, based on analysis, planning changes, managing changes, and ongoing continuous improvement.
  • Liaise between Google Legal, Sales, and Customer to interpret clauses, negotiate on redlines and draft potential contractual changes for legal approval. Build productive relationships and feedback loops with Legal, Finance, Sales and Product teams to drive efficiencies.
Minimum qualifications
  • BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience drafting/redlining contracts for EMEA customers.
  • Industry experience in contract management or sales operations roles at a technology firm.
Preferred qualifications
  • Solid working knowledge of commercial Customer Relationship Manager (CRM) and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving experience, combined with strong business judgment and an ability to present analysis in a clear and compelling manner.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead complex strategic and operational initiatives.
  • Excellent communication skills, facilitating clear and open communication at all levels of the organization.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
Area
We've helped millions of employees and organizations around the world to "go Google." As masters of cloud computing, the Google for Work team helps small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies discover the wonders of "the cloud" and work smarter. Our technical and sales teams design and implement solutions for these organizations with custom features, security and support -- all with Google's philosophy of innovation and ease of use in mind.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Google for Work helps companies around the globe be more productive, mobile and collaborative by "going Google." From educational institutions to government agencies, you support business of all sizes, helping them ramp-up quickly on enterprise offerings.

item.title: Quality Assurance Engineer Cashier
item.dc:creator: demo
item.content:encoded:
As a Quality Assurance Engineer, you will work with a number of teams at Dropbox to maintain a high level of quality in the product. You will be joining a small team at a critical time to define the role and presence of Quality Assurance at Dropbox.

Benefits & Perks

  • Set your own Dropbox storage quota
  • Free breakfast, lunch and dinner daily, plus tons of snacks and beverages
  • Office across from the SF Giants’ ballpark
  • Really flexible hours
  • Eighteen days of paid vacation and eleven paid holidays
  • If you’re sick, just stay home and get better
  • Subsidized gym and commuter programs, including our very own Dropbox shuttle service within San Francisco
  • 401(k)
  • Vision, dental, life, and health insurance too
  • Join the band. Complete music studio equipped with drums, P.A., amplifiers, etc…
  • Whiskey Fridays
  • Gaming! Starcraft, dedicated game rooms, DDR (yep, a real machine), ping pong, tournaments, and more

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: you can send direct email or send via saved CV

item.title: Senior UX Designer
item.dc:creator: hasanrang05
item.content:encoded:
Microsoft IT is for those IT professionals and business technology professionals who want to be strategic partners to the business and be the first place to create innovative solutions using all of Microsoft’s products and services. Microsoft IT provides career growth opportunities, a rewarding and flexible work environment so you can better integrate professional and personal life. Unlike other IT organizations, Microsoft IT employees make global impact on thousands of customers and thousands of employees who use Microsoft software and services.
Are you an industry leader with a stunningly visually appealing portfolio, proven leadership skills, and a history of program execution? Are you looking for a new opportunity to grow and flaunt your skills across an enterprise organization? If so, we are the team for you! Come be a big fish in a small pond. Come join a team responsible for innovation and design for some of the most picky and thoughtful users in the world-Microsoft’s own growing band of employees in addition to the diverse needs of our partners, customers and suppliers.
We are looking for an accomplished creative director or visual designer with a broad set of skills. A designer with experience delivering complete look and feel programs for web services and software applications. Someone who commands respect and has no ego. Someone who takes pride in delivering quality concepts and explorations as well as visual design specs and CSS.
The ideal candidate will have experience with customer and user research, brand identity and implementation, UX strategy development, and motion graphics. In addition, the candidate will illustrate the ability to build respect and credibility with stakeholders and fellow designers. Will embrace ambiguity, articulate tradeoffs, and drive to meet deadlines. Will have a strong hand and a keen eye in order to produce storyboards, mood boards, icons, identity, animations, etc. Prototyping and scripting skills a plus.
Minimum Qualifications:
All candidates must provide a resume, an online portfolio, and relevant work samples along with inquiries
8+ years of experience in product/web/interaction design
Directly or Indirectly leading a team of Visual Designers in development of visual design concepts based on user research for large, complex, global solutions.
Preferred Qualifications:
Corporate software development experience.
Strong, hands-on visual and graphic design skills
Past ownership of entire design programs end-to-end
Bachelor’s or Master’s in graphic design or fine art or related field preferred. May be substituted with significant industry experience and accomplishments.
Working knowledge of the following products/technologies: Adobe Creative Suite, Balsamiq, CSS
About our team:
Our team delivers long-term user and customer value to Microsoft’s over 100,000 employees and partners around the world. Our diverse UX team boasts a variety of research accessibility, interaction design, and visual design skills. We produce a variety of interactive and scalable solutions; compelling user research and customer insights. We require strong persuasive and communication skills; awareness of technology trends; and an ability to balance business and user needs. Microsoft IT professionals are strategic partners to Microsoft business groups. We are often the first team to innovate and to explore new technologies and new design solutions. Microsoft IT provides career growth opportunities, a rewarding and flexible work environment, and global impact.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Microsoft IT is for those IT professionals and business technology professionals who want to be strategic partners to the business and be the first place to create innovative solutions using all of Microsoft’s products and services.
How to apply your job, instruction for applicant ?

item.title: WordPress Front-End Developer
item.dc:creator: hasanrang05
item.content:encoded:
As a developer at our headquarters in Dupont Circle, you’ll develop responsive themes for WordPress. You’ll use Sass, Bundler and Grunt (past experience with these preferred, but not necessarily required) to automate what you can, so you can focus on writing clean, performant code. You’ll work with our team of developers, designers, UXers, strategists, and project managers to develop and maintain WordPress websites.
At CHIEF, we take front-end development seriously, and we hope you do too. Our developers have presented on Sass, accessible theming, building more intuitive administrative interfaces, and building solid client relationships through prototyping and site building review. If that sounds like the environment for you, shoot us your resume and let us know why you’d be a great fit.
Position is full-time and on-site. No agencies or recruiters please.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Hand-code clean, semantic, standards-compliant and responsive HTML and CSS3 themes. Evaluate designs, wireframes and other deliverables during the design and user experience phase for potential development issues and flag problems appropriately. Create graceful fallbacks for complex CSS3 styling in old Internet Explorer browsers (back to IE9, and occasionally IE8). Conduct peer review of themes created by other developers. Conduct cross-browser and cross-device testing to ensure consistent display in major supported browsers on Mac, PC, iOS and Android platforms. Clearly communicate the intricacies of complex web development issues, acting as a subject matter expert both internally across departments and externally with clients. Perform site-building activities, including creating and modifying views, contexts and blocks in order to match functionality specified in wireframes and designs. Install, test and debug WordPress plugins. Prototype functionality for internal and client review.

Bachelor’s degree. 2+ years professional web development experience. Ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize appropriately. Excellent communication skills, attention to detail and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment. U.S. citizenship.

Expert HTML & CSS skills with full understanding of web standards and responsive design techniques. Familiarity with Sass. Experience with WordPress front-end development and configuration. Experience with Git version control.

Experience with Drush. Strong understanding of jQuery and other JavaScript libraries. Familiarity with PHP development. Basic understanding of accessibility best practices, Section 508 compliance and/or WCAG 2.0 standards.
Familiarity with grid-based responsive web design. Ability to estimate time and level of effort accurately for front-end development tasks. Ability to manipulate and slice PSDs and InDesign files.

At CHIEF, we take front-end development seriously, and we hope you do too. Our developers have presented on Sass, accessible theming, building more intuitive administrative interfaces, and building solid client relationships through prototyping and site building review.
Please send CV to our email.
